Articles.Content:
Other than my plane being on fire, which is completely normal,

Why is one intake getting more air than the other?

Everything on my plane is completely symmetrical, and I am level with Kerbin.

PS-

I forgot to mention this happens with every plane I make.

I mean its not much of a problem, I can compensate for it,

But its just a little odd to me.

Edited July 29, 2013 by sodra

They're both at 3.71U, so they're producing equal amounts of air.

For the resource amount, I'm going out on a flaming wing and guessing that each frame the computation goes:

(1) the 0.04 intake produces air and gets to 0.07

(2) the jets burn part of the stored air, both intakes are down to 0.04

(3) the 0.07 intake produces air and gets to 0.07

Which would be a result of the order the parts were created in the SPH/VAB. I'm not 100% on that.
I experience the same problem. I think it's safe to ignore.
